You’re doing the right thing by getting grounded before the talk. The goal tonight isn’t to solve everything; it’s to get on the same page and choose a few concrete next steps. Here’s a simple way to keep it calm and productive.

Before the talk (15–20 min)
- Quick reset (3 minutes):

- Gather just the basics:
  - Cash on hand (checking/savings)
  - Severance net amount and how many weeks it covers
  - Mortgage payment and due date
  - Other must-pays: utilities, insurance, car, minimum debt payments
  - Estimated monthly spend on groceries/gas
  - Spouse’s income (if any) and timing
  - Unemployment status (filed/not filed; rough estimate)

How to open the conversation
- “I’m anxious and I don’t want that to spill on you. I love you and I want us to look at this together. Tonight let’s just get a clear snapshot and pick a few actions for this week.”

Ground rules to keep it steady
- Time-box to 45 minutes.
- Numbers are neutral; no blame, no “should haves.”
- If either of us feels flooded, we take a 2-minute pause and come back.

One-page money snapshot (fill in together)
- Cash now: $____
- Incoming next 60 days:
  - Severance net: $____
  - Spouse income: $____/mo
  - Unemployment estimate: $____/mo starting ______
  - Other (if any): $____
- Core monthly expenses:
  - Mortgage/escrow: $____ (due ___)
  - Utilities (power/water/internet/phone): $____
  - Insurance/health: $____
  - Food/household: $____
  - Transportation (gas/maintenance/insurance): $____
  - Debt minimums: $____
  - Childcare/school: $____

  - Dining/entertainment: $____
